intro: Blepharis ruwenzoriensis, commonly known as the Ruwenzori blepharis, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassland habitats at elevations above 2,500 meters. Its flowers are usually pale blue or purple, and it blooms during the cooler months. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
